page.title: 06EMLEY MOOR COLLIERY
page.content: By 1597 there were several small mines at work in and around Emley. The coal seams in this part of the Pennine foothills are thin and throughout the eighteenth century the mines were operated by a few men _ usually not more than six per mine. In the 1939 to 1945 war, and in the 1950's and 1960's, open cast mining became a common sight in the area. The railway through Skelmanthorpe to Clayton West was commenced in 1872 and led to a screening plant being erected at Skelmanthorpe. Coal from Nine Clogs Drift and Speedwell collieries was conveyed there at first in tubs to the station via Skelmanthorpe Dayhole with the help of a steam haulage at Nine Clogs Drift. Later coal was conveyed from Emley Moor colliery.
